markdownRemark.html:
On 24-26 June 2020, several C4DM researchers will participate virtually at the 17th Sound and Music Computing Conference (SMC 2020). SMC is the flagship conference of the Sound and Music Computing community. For this year, the scientific (paper) track of SMC is co-chaired by C4DM member Dr Charalampos Saitis and organised as a virtual conference offering free and open attendance to everyone, without registration. The SMC 2020 keynotes, oral presentations, and music program will be streamed on a dedicated YouTube channel.

The following papers authored/co-authored by C4DM members will be presented:

  • Identifying master violinists using note-level audio features (Y Zhao, G Fazekas and M Sandler)


Paper (publicly available on SMC website/proceedings)

  • Musical dynamics classification with CNN and modulation spectra (L Marinelli [future C4DM PhD student], A Lykartsis, C Saitis and S Weinzierl)


Paper (publicly available on SMC website/proceedings)

  • Sonification as Negotiation - Learning from Translation Studies (G Lepri)


Paper (publicly available on SMC website/proceedings)

Videos will be made available after the conference.
